meal_sub_category.description: Foods designed to support muscle growth, often high in protein and calories to aid in muscle repair and increase mass
Meals focused on calorie control, often with lower fat and carb content to help achieve weight loss goals
Balanced meals aimed at maintaining current body weight, providing a mix of nutrients to support overall health
The first meal of the day, typically high in nutrients to kickstart metabolism and provide energy for the morning
A mid-day meal designed to replenish energy, often with a balanced mix of protein, carbs, and vegetables
The evening meal, which can vary in size and composition depending on personal goals, but typically provides a source of protein and vegetables
Meals consumed before a workout to provide energy, typically higher in carbs and moderate in protein
Meals eaten after a workout to aid recovery, typically high in protein to repair muscles and moderate in carbs to replenish energy
Meals that minimize carbohydrate intake, focusing on high-protein, fat, and fiber to promote fat burning
Meals with a focus on protein, essential for muscle repair and growth, often used in fitness or bodybuilding diets
Plant-based meals that exclude all animal products, including meat, dairy, and eggs
Meals that exclude meat, but may include dairy products and eggs
A diet based on eating foods that would have been available to early humans, such as meat, fish, fruits, vegetables, nuts, and seeds, while avoiding processed foods
Meals that exclude gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye, for those with gluten sensitivities or celiac disease
A dish typically consisting of a mixture of vegetables, fruits, nuts, and often topped with dressings or proteins
Dishes based around meat such as beef, chicken, or pork, often grilled, roasted, or cooked in various ways
Dishes centered around fruits, often served fresh or as part of a dessert or side dish
Sweet dishes typically served at the end of a meal, such as cakes, pies, and ice cream
